content: वितॄ {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To cross or pass over, go beyond; <ls>R. 6. 77.</ls> {@--2@} To give, grant, impart, confer or bestow on, vouchsafe, favour with; भगवान् मारचिस्ते दर्शनं वितरति <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; वितरति गुरुः प्राज्ञे विद्यां यथैव तथा जडे <ls>U. 2. 4</ls>; वितरति नृपो नोचितमहा <ls>Pt. 1. 11</ls>; <ls>U. 3. 48</ls>; निवासहेतोरुटजं वितेरुः <ls>R. 14. 81</ls>; <ls>Māl. 1. 3</ls>; <ls n="Māl.">6. 7</ls>; <ls n="Māl.">9. 5</ls>, <ls n="Māl. 9.">44.</ls> {@--3@} To cause, produce; ज्योत्स्नाशंकामिह वितरति हंसश्रेणी <ls>Ki. 5. 31.</ls> {@--4@} To carry over, ferry over. {@--5@} To give (as medicine), apply a remedy. {@--6@} To do, perform. {@--7@} To forgive, pardon. {@--8@} To increase, enhance. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} To carry through, accomplish (<ab>fig.</ab> also).
